oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Pvt. Alexander Brabson Walker describing the Battle of Stones River
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pvt. Alexander B. Walker was in the 12th (Day's) Tenn. Cav. Bn., CSA, and part of the January 1863 retreat of Bragg's army from Murfreesboro, Tenn. In describing the battle, Walker wrote, "I have seen the elephent [sic]," a common phrase among Civil War soldiers to describe having experienced heavy combat.
